author: Jerry Michalsky, Sports Editor, jerrymichalsky@aol.com
title: Tigers tame Bobcats 56-20
text:
Tigers tame Bobcats 56-20 By Jerry Michalsky, Sports Editor, jerrymichalsky@aol.com The Vindicator | 0 comments 
West Sabine grabbed an early half-time lead then added more in the second half to take a 56-20 win over Hull-Daisetta on Friday night at Tiger Stadium. C.J. Williams would get the first points of the game for West Sabine by scoring on a 22-yard run and after a successful two-point conversion it was 8-0. Midway through the first quarter it was Williams finding the endzone again, this time from 20-yards out and then he would add the conversion run and the Tigers had a 16-0 lead. West Sabine looked to be driving again but a fumble would be recovered by the Bobcats Dylan Varnon. Hull-Daisetta then put together a nice drive which was a highlighted by a 45-yard run quarterback Brandon Maughan but a goal line stand would keep the Bobcats out of the end zone. The Tigers then responded a with a nice 95-yard drive with Demaria Smith scoring from the eight-yard line to make it 24-0 with 2:00 left in the half. Hull-Daisetta would get a big play just before the first half would come to a close as Maughan would connect with Bryce Fregia on a 70-yard score to make it 24-6 at the half. The Bobcats would draw midway through the third quarter as Fregia would find Maughan on a 20-yard score and the lead was cut in half at 24-12. West Sabine would respond quickly with a couple of scores as Williams would score on a 15 and 36 yard run to make it 40-12 with 3:17 left in the third quarter. After the Tigers would recover the following onside kick it was Smith scoring from 35-yards to put the game away at 48-12. Smith would get the final score of the night for West Sabine by crossing the goal line from 30-yards out to make it 56-12 with 9:00 left in the game. Hull-Daisetta (1-4), would get the final score of the night with Fregia connecting with Maughan on a 20-yard strike with 4:13 left in the game.
